title: Real-world probability
prompt: A box of candy contains 24 light chocolates and 12 dark chocolates. If you choose a piece of candy without looking, what is the probability of choosing a dark chocolate?
hint: Odds is a ratio of the desired event to the total number of possible outcomes.
feedback:
This question asks for the probability of choosing a dark chocolate at random out of a box. The probability is the ratio of dark chocolates to all chocolates in the box. By adding together the light chocolates and the dark chocolates, you can find the total number of chocolates in the box: 36.
24 light chocolates + 12 dark chocolates = 36 chocolates The number of dark chocolates is 12, giving a ratio of 12 in 36, or 1/3.
